newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Ireland's TSB Bank raises variable lending rates.
newsitem.headline: Ireland's TSB Bank raises variable lending rates.

text.p: Ireland's TSB Bank said on Thursday that it was raising its variable lending rates with effect from Monday, May 12.
TSB said in a statement that it was increasing its standard variable mortgage rate by 40 basis points to 7.4 percent.
The move follows the Irish central bank's decision to raise the official Short Term Facility Rate (STF) by 50 basis points on May 1.
A number of other lending institutions, including Irish Permanent, Allied Irish Banks, Bank of Ireland and First National Building Society, have already raised their rates.
